K-fF2S0Jh4DsboVB4wYRAg.text: Very good meat pies! We were so underdressed compared to all the businessmen but it didn't matter because we were in meat pie heaven.

FJj-kEfzNPwc7uFZ06p_qg.text: This is a great pub. I liked the London beer on tap, the good customer service, and the roof terrace where we enjoyed our meal. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the meals we ordered were as well. The Shepherd's Pie was the favourite, but we were all happy with what we ordered. In the evenings, one can find parking on the streets nearby.

c3TmUp7hVDMt23_zY9oD-g.text: Known for its pies, this pub gets very busy of an evening, especially during  the darker months when a pie and ale is just the tonic for a cold London.We popped by here in the summer, so it was less busy (no outdoor space) but it was relaxed, with the Olympics coverage providing the occasional burst of excitement.It's a Youngs pub, so if you're new to London and want to try some decent ale, you could do a lot worse.

Kz-TWFp9aa0uN6MHH9b7pA.text: After a recommendation, decided to try the windmill based on the steak and kidney pie.... OH MY! It doesn't disappoint! Perfect combination of tender, flavorsome mean and delicious flaky pastry, so its no surprise they have won an award for it.

CdDkKMI5Uzz2MXaVsr2PqQ.text: When we travel as a family part of our experience is to try the local fare. We like to try good eateries away from the hustle and the bustle of tourist traps. This trip took us 2 buses from Waterloo but it was an adorable place. I was a little disappointed as the night we were there the only "pie" available was a chicken and leek pie and I so badly wanted a real British pie for dinner but the Cottage/Shepards Pie was delicious. The dessert of sticky toffee pudding was also delicious. We live in California and I grew up in South Africa. We do not get meat pies in California. I was hoping to have at least one pie in England. The closest I got was a M&S sausage roll from Waterloo Station. The dinner however was delicious and the place is so adorable and full of locals.

rfHktyKIgCgN3wsY9o9K8w.text: Walking around aimlessly in posh business area, how did we get over here anyway?! American friend visiting wanted fish and chips. Out comes my phone's yelp app for some fish n chips nearby. Closest pub in the neighborhood, check. Cool dark friendly pub with business men (seriously Mr Monopoly was sitting next to us doing a crossword) and locals and friendly gold toothed bar maid making it outstanding. FOOD! Turns out this place is known for its pies. And they do look tasty. But we order the haddock and it is crunchy (able to withstand all the lemon and vinegar slathers you can shake at it) and the tartare sauce is just right. Definitely cool hidden place that I will come back to reveal to more american tourists. But don't worry, I'll blindfold them for the journey or something. BEER! They have guest cask beers that rotate monthly and have a taster paddle. A pound something each for 3, 1/3 pint tasters of the guest casks. ROOM!? There's an upstairs "pie room" which seems like a private room. Went on a monday afternoon and it didn't look open, not sure if you can just go up whenever.

1CuIQrnNIVm5NAgIV8-2Cw.text: I really liked this place. From the friendly  but undoubtedly quirky  staff, to the very well kept Youngs beer, the great food, the comfy tables and the really well laid out dining areas, this pub really does tick all the boxes.If you're looking for a good pie and a decent pint, then I can't think of anywhere else in the location that can touch this place.

3PAXwpxayhb6kPzTXO3MoA.text: I was looking for authentic Shepherd's pie which I've never had before as a silly American whose diet consists mostly of in-n-out and umami burger, and found this place on yelp/tripadvisor, boasting it's national awards for 3 separate years.  I'm not a huge fan of English food, but this is one of the best things I've ever tasted in my life.  They have several different pies that change everyday, but the traditional shepherd's pie was simply fantastic.  And for under 10 pounds, I found it to be quite the bargain (considering it's fantastic service, true and authentic crowd, admirable decor, and the simple fact that it's in a city as expensive as London).Washing it down with a pint or 10 of their fantastic award-winning selection of beer before pairing it with a delicious toffee pudding was just a fantastic start to our London trip.  I would recommend to any and everyone visiting, and would love to go there again soon.

hSqNUIcRkX94d2Nu_RFzPw.text: The kidney pie was great. My companions and I had a good time there in early August 2014. My complaint is that somehow they got my email address. I don't remember giving it to them. Since then (over 3 months) I have been getting newsletters and promotions emailed to me. I live in Canada so it makes no sense for me to get these. I have on numerous occasions opted out of further communications using their online tool. I have sent an email to their reservation address, and yet I keep getting their promotions. Businesses who have an online presence MUST respect the most basic of consumer rights and etiquette. The WindMill does not.

5F_cnWi498hlDtQdgPqFBw.text: A real gem in that most tourist trap laden ghetto, the West End.  This is an excellent, pub, close to Oxford Circus, yet far from the madding crowd.  A Youngs house with a couple of guest ales, frequented predominantly by those that work in the area and the lucky few that live there.Try the award winning (seriously) steak and kidney pie.  It has a light short crust pastry, is meaty, beaty big and bouncy, has a sufficiency of kidneys and a deliciously tingley pepperiness.  If you have to meet with someone in this part of town, this place should be very high up on your list of lets meet here places.

ASA6Btse7ZI00QB0cSjGIw.text: Perfect establishment for our last meal in London before heading home. It was very, very crowded. We were lucky to get a table in the back room where we could order food. I had a pie and my husband had the fish and chips. There is an upstairs 'pie room' and rooftop terrace (with smoking). The staff was friendly if a little stressed. Drinks and food came fast. Overall I would recommend.

145e5qQ_oux8PxWghmywvg.text: You must know something. I love pie. This place serves an award winning steak and kidney pie. I did not know something. Kidneys are actually kidneys and not kidney beans. Yes, I'm probably retarded. Regardless, it was a good pie. Next time I will not order kidney, haha. I'm sure it is a good source of iron but it tastes like chicken liver which tastes like dirt.And I can vouch that there were media people there, because I was :)

uyPhoykd6iqHcQ-KsPCaxw.text: Awesome place. Pub culture in UK unfortunately just can't be recreated back home in CA. Great vibe andenergy on weeknights, businessmen, locals, groups of girls having cider, shoppers. Loved the local ales - London and Cornwall based. Had steak and kidney pie with mash, and fish (haddock) and chips. Sticky toffee pudding for dessert. Love the classic old decor.

2JBcxR4Mcjso0EbElMClPg.text: This pub is loaded with media people from soho, all I could hear was conversations buzzing about films, production who edited what etc etc.White Table Clothes, and fine traditional english food, this place as a comfortable mid weight option for building the bridge between casual and semi formal. serving award winning food such a Steak and Kidney Pies, fish and chips,  Cured meats, and pates.. this is an excellent resort to introducing over sea's clients too Fine English food. you never know, they may even enjoy it! ;)I came here, and had a really enjoyable time. For what they are aiming to do glorify english cusine, I think they do it well.. not too frilly, not to functional, fine line but a good balance.

cN65KMumVUQ725ccled6bw.text: A quaint and cute pub tucked into a relatively quiet street just off Regent Street. The pub has pretty standard drinks and beer, with a good selection of English ales. The food is a bit pricey, and takes a while to prepare, but it's good quality. The pies are the go-to dish, which are served hot and savory. I tried my first steak and kidney pie here; it was good and flakey, though you should prepare for how kidney tastes. Friendly servers too, but then again it was a quiet weekday afternoon when I popped in.

DGjkcxp9HaYt61vWgqgYRQ.text: Despairing at the atmosphere and lack of seats in the nearby Coach and Horses, my companions and I set off in search of a better venue. We were as delighted to find The Windmill as Lawrence of Arabia no doubt was to find Omar Sharif when he lost his way in a parallel universe. The Windmill makes some bold claims in the form of banners from the Institute of Pie Excellence saluting its steak and kidney pies. My chaps and I were not here for the food, however, and embarked on a swift couple of Guinnesses so no report can be given on the grub. This venue is large and was remarkably quiet for a Saturday afternoon. There is also an excellent view of a rubber-wear shop next door where the clientele will provide much merriment if it is to be found in short supply with your comrades. Paddyman's verdict? A relief after the touristic nightmare of the Coach and Horses, this pub has some amusing pictures in its toilets (a big fan of this) which more than compensated for the "haven't-quite-worked-out-how-to-clean-the-bogs-since-the-smoking-ban" whiff around and about the gents. Repeat visits will confirm my suspicion that this pub may be a little gem given its location.

e4doKjInxt74fmEnzO6pmA.text: We stopped by here on the recommendation that they were the best place to grab a steak and kidney pie in all of London. They do boast several large signs over the bar bragging on their multiple awards. We found this spot cozy, friendly and with good food and drink. We weren't starving, but picked up a steak and mushroom pie that came with chips and mushy peas. Everything was delicious. A good selection of beers. Fair prices. It was busy for a short time right after work hours, but cleared out quickly after the businessmen finished their pints. Some colorful neighborhood old codgers completely rounded out this experience for us.

GvR2AYFFviiW-4KDcwRjOA.text: Good beer selection (both ale and lager), very comforting pie. A bit pricy with 5.3 a pint but that's the location taking its toll.

2Sb1smFiJiPnVqHOKTBawg.text: Had dinner here with my family. The food was all pretty solid. Decent value.Somewhat uninspiring selection of beers, though. The service was average.A good spot to have a classic pub meal.

wbjzyGsMq0jWwXd5aykORQ.text: Food was pretty decent with large portions, but they don't give take out containers for unfinished food! What a waste, I wish I knew beforehand.

YISrVqSqnU_CodFo406xig.text: We had the lamb shank pie and fish and chips. Had to wait over 30 minutes due to our server just taking off but the food was worth the wait. My pie was hot, creamy and hearty. Loved the side of veggies. Partners fish was well battered and seasoned well. Had a lovely meal. Pale ale was tasty. Nice spot.

-Jwm5JZ7X0EZ3WCIIDbaLQ.text: Stopped by for lunch during the middle of the week. Ordered a Shepard pie and stout. The Shepard pie was delicious. Full of flavor and the right textures. I can still picture it when I close my eyes. The stout was a perfect match. If I wasn't so full and satisfied from the pie I would've finished it all. Definitely plan to return one day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Shepard pie

EYHnYHcAVU3cbiVkpeVMLA.text: Got the Shepard pie which had a ton of lamb flavor, I don't normally eat lamb so it was too much lamb for me. My boyfriend got the fish pie which wasn't bad but wasn't amazing. The food was ok

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Fish pie
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shepherds pie
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Beer

Vwvk2BYoRvOe7DBJsrlrgA.text: Went in based on the yelp recommendations. The food was great!!!! Plenty of beers to choose from. Very good service and cool atmosphere. The steak mushrooms pie was absolutely delicious. I'll visit again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Steak mushrooms pie

0bfXGIhF7ytYkb_dDzIYag.text: I ordered the seasonal special Game Pie, and the staff suggested I have a side of gravy, which was spot on. Very good food, friendly service, which made for a nice Christmas Eve dinner.

1_AqDgvous-ZL_-KIJqwWg.text: On my recent visit to London, I was naturally craving a traditional meat pie.  My friend and I did a quick search and found The Windmill.  I was impressed with the selection of pies and the food was absolutely delicious.  We were able to sit outside on the rooftop patio, and enjoy some drinks in the sun.

pJKWaB_B0maoMD0N4hqeaA.text: Came here specifically for the steak and kidney pie and it didn't dissapoint. Good flakey crust. Truly amazing. And whatever standard vegetables they gave were amazing. Maybe it was kale. I dunno. Wow

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Steak and kidney pie. So tasty

OtvsC_N6bESRsxjPogIKIQ.text: Best meat pie I have ever had! We spent our London trip eating meat pies all over the city and the ones at Windmill were definitely the best. This is an unassuming pub right behind the main shopping street of Piccadilly Circus so it is an ideal place to stop by after a long day of shopping. The place is filled with locals and I felt like the only tourist there. I hope this Yelp review doesn't ruin that. There is plenty of seating but we sat in the main room. The terrace and meat pie rooms also looked great. We ordered the steak and ale pie and the steak and kidney pie. Both were amazing. Don't ruin them with gravy, the gravy inside was incredible and even better spread on the mash that comes on the side. The tap selection was typical for London pubs and the prices quite reasonable. I will definitely be recommending this place to all my friends when they visit London and I can't wait to go back!

xdGKxHYKSKOQyTAYv-cojg.text: Great atmosphere, closed at weird hours, but the shepherds pie is delicious, a bit over seasoned but if you are looking for a good pie, you can find it here! A nice place, nothing amazing.

bCEtYAypCFQjS8WW-wCmtg.text: Crowded, stuffy, noisy, and full of English folk who are really into meat pie. Food didn't look healthy at all.But to each his own.

0MdYJMn8WmmVbHl2gpgQ2Q.text: Mmmmmm....pie. Pie pie pie pie pie pie pie. PIE! Now that I've thoroughly dated myself with that reference, I'll say that the Windmill lives up to its claim as being the best place in the area for pies. We had some drinks at the bar/outside and later came in and found a seat in "Pie Room Too" and ordered. Around the table there were choices of chicken/leek, steak/mushroom, haloumi, & one other. Everyone loved the pies. I had the steak & mushroom and it was delish! I'd have rather gotten chips than mashed potatoes, but forgot to order that way. No problem, though. The pie pastry was very nice and the seasoning just scrumptious. I'll definitely keep The Windmill in mind for a nice pub meal when I'm out shopping, etc.

cnXEFVSp35dJYnUZiG0ZUA.text: Sadly I can't review this place because despite making a reservation they did not have a table. When I asked for the purpose of a reservation I was told that "we do not have a table". I walked around the corner to Goodman and would highly recommend it! To those who like herring - they have the best!

TxiDcKVoqBu45QehLNPcjw.text: We were wandering along Regent Street looking for a pub when a passerby heard our discussion. A local, he directed us back past the Apple Store to the Windmill as the best pub in the area for a pint. Following his directions led us to this wonderful pie shop restaurant with a few drafts on offer. We ended up with two pints of a real ale called Milkwood, which was oddly produced by Brains brewery. I might have to steal one of these glasses that says "Brains" on it.Good service, the very loud bell rang at 10:50 with an apology for last call and then again 10 minutes later.They have a fruit machine that was loudly being used for a trivial pursuit / battleship game by a bunch of shirt and tie folks when we got in, it got a bit quieter so we could actually hear outselves talk.

WPPn1L9IC8jgluIcAPUKFA.text: I visited The Windmill on Friday, 21st June 2013. I had a party size of 6 adults. The restaurant was full so I'm glad I made a reservation. I have eaten in the sister restaurant The Ginea Grill a few times and have tried the steak and mushroom pie there, so I was very excited about coming here.We tried to order some Oysters, they only had seven remaining and had to ask the chef if they could sell us all seven as they usually only sell them in threes. I was wondering what they would do with the one left over if they refused to sell it to us! The french oysters were excellent, just not enough of them. We also ordered some prawn fish cakes which were excellent. Onto the main courses, this time I tried the steak and kidney pie. This has won three awards previously as the best pie in London, and I can see why. The pie was excellent, the pastry, the meat...I was asked to complete a feedback card at the end, my comments were they shouldn't change a thing. It was perfect. For sides I tried the mash and mushy pea's. the peas were good, however the mash potato was a bit dry.Overall I enjoyed this experience. I will come back and dine again. The reason for the four stars and not five, the oyster incident with the waitress and the restaurant only having seven remaining (we originally wanted 18)

mQTeUWp1W6OBQcpdm1CGJQ.text: Wonderful rooftop terrace with the best steak and kidney pie in London, three years running. Service was fast and efficient. They started serving lunch (and thus pie) at 11:45. If I had more time here I would come back to try their seasonal pies.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Steak and Kidney pie with greens & a Young's. All was delicious; service was fast and efficient on their lovely roof terrace.

CAYZxacYYm9WYV_Emr9Cig.text: The Shepherd's Pie was incredible as was the Fish and Chips. The upstairs dinning area was quiet despite the crowd downstairs watching the soccer match. The waiter explained that the Shepherd's Pie was award winning and there was a sign and newspaper articles on the wall to back it up. I would return just to have the Shepherd's Pie. After a week in Italy, we had reservations at a trendy restaurant down the street. We ended canceling them for a night of Pub dinning at The Windmill Mayfair.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. The Windmill Mayfair in London
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Award Winning Shepherd's Pie at The Windmill Mayfair, London
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips at The Windmill Mayfair, London

Hg2HPbSc5tnytFwhw-Wg8A.text: The Windmill lays claim to the best pies in Central London; thus far I haven't tried anywhere good enough to be even close to disputing this. Their pies ARE top-notch, and the setting really compliments the traditional English pub fare.Pubs in Mayfair (and indeed the surrounding areas of Piccadilly and Soho) tend to be in the same mould: traditional old English style; smaller places on narrow streets, decked in wood panelling, somewhat dark, offering real ales and "traditional pub food". Ask anyone what that latter part means, and they'll say one of two things: fish & chips, or pies. Given that proper steak or chicken pies are clearly a staple attraction of a traditional pub & grub establishment, competition for "the best" is fierce, and many claim to have it.From what I've experienced, The Windmill does it better than most. It is a favourite here in the office; special occasions and company lunch outings tend to be in this direction; especially to treat out-of-town guests to a good steak pie. Or chicken pie. Or whatever else happens to be on the menu at that time. There is a good selection of pie, and often the specials further add to the list, along with other classic pub menu options such as the aforementioned fish & chips, burgers, and so on. But the pie is their main event; they even call their back restaurant area "The Pie Room" and upstairs "The Pie Room 2". These settings are typical of the area, far removed from bright windows and drinkers squeezing into the limited outside space - there's a new roof terrace offering a handful of drinkers a little bit of extra room to enjoy sunshine; but big groups are seated indoors. I've had one less-than-ideal experience, owing to a nasty smell emanating from the toilets upstairs, but my other visits have shown that this was a rare accident.Said bigger groups, as we are used to dining in, are well catered for by excellent waiting staff who never miss a beat in terms of being attentive and receiving (and delivering) your order quickly. Bar staff are friendly and will recommend the pick of the week's ales to match your order. If you're only here to drink, it's likely standing room only, and unfortunately it's a tiny street so perhaps is only recommended if there are a handful of folk in your group.The food itself is delicious. I am a huge fan of the steak and mushroom pie; many colleagues prefer the chicken and leek. On our last visit, there was a spicy chicken and chorizo pie on the specials menu, with flaky pastry and humous. Those who tried it, loved it. The pies are generously sized and full of meat; the mash nice and creamy. My order also arrived with a side pot of gravy, which made the mash even nicer. A recommended addition to your pie dish are the "greens" - cooked in and served with bacon bits. Deliciously addictive. The only negative I can give on the food side is that it can taste quite salty. Not the healthiest of choices, but if you're not here often it shouldn't do you any harm - it certainly doesn't make it taste bad, unlike some places where the food has been so salty it is inedible.Overall, I like the Windmill. I love having a drink there when it's quiet, though at busy times it's a squeeze. But I love their food, and I think if you do come here for the best pie in London, and get a nice seat, you probably won't be disappointed.

3XrAohW4FSVMqvMbcc7dmw.text: Perfect pies. We tried the steak and mushroom and shepherds pie and both were exceptional. The crust  was really good . The gravy sauce to be added on the mash is really nice homemade taste. The service was great our server was friendly and welcoming .

kDzmM1cyBu3YHhhiN12lmw.text: Authentic pub atmosphere. I found this place because my husband insisted on a meat pie during our London trip. Brian ordered the short rib and horseradish pie. Which was so so. I ordered fish and chips that were also okay. We went and ate in the pie room but I wish we had stayed downstairs where it was a bit more lively.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Short rib meat pie
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

X9UIdoDk3P4kWrtMWgX90A.text: Yes, pies are good, but on a slow Saturday afternoon we waited over 20 minutes for them (in fairness, we were warned by the staff regarding wait time).   The service was weak - despite the small crowd and ample, bored staff, no one made an effort to clear our table for a half hour after we were done - we ended up doing it ourselves so we could enjoy our drinks before leaving.  Not impressed.

nDXgikhVszk69QQOfdx5kQ.text: Amazing Food and Amazing service. The gentleman that helped us a few days ago that sat my wife, myself and my four year old deserves an award in customer service. Absolutely amazing and the Steak and Kidney Pie was the best I've ever had! Very well done!

hnZDq31Rt5Vj0Ni2qm6tQQ.text: Came here because I read that they were voted best pies in London. The best part of the pie was the crust, nice and flakey, the steak and mushrooms inside was ok. I also ordered three other side dishes and they were not worth mentioning. Service was not the best, but they do have a nice garden seating upstairs and the place is quite cozy.

dwa3EC4DkZ5EhLvHtsgVmg.text: The best meat pie I have ever had in my entire life!  Although the service seemed a little off, the food was so good I am giving 5 stars anyway.

lwV4YAtJZPnVBVS5rNXmrg.text: We were visiting from the states and hell bent on trying some local British fare. This far exceeded our exceptions. We ordered Shepard's pie, fish and chips and some kind of dessert. Everything was insanely good! Service was nice and fast and 3 months later, I'm still craving those fish n chips. I will absolutely go back if I'm ever in the area again.

-KrYIX3Qah0AgILlsk6itw.text: The Windmill is an unsuspecting pub in Mayfair. Full on the outside and the inside with office types so reservations are necessary. Their website proudly presents they specialise in pies and even their rooms are named the upper and lower pie rooms! So what else would I go for on a wet London evening but steak and kidney pie??The pie itself had a crispy top, searing hot inner filled to the top with tender beef, not too many kidneys though. Thick gravy binding everything together pretty much perfectly. If I was fussy, I would say more kidney please! Mash was good, slightly larger portion would have been useful. Creamy spring greens were delicious and the perfect accompaniment.Service was efficient, friendly and willing to help. Overall, a great pie in an unexpected location. I would return for any future pie requirements.

kkCHDtbxn0yY0-jPgcPcvg.text: Pies, Pie Room, and Pie Room Too!Think I happened upon it looking for a pub nearby to eat at.  From the outside, and being a lovely evening, both sides of the street were packed with the post-work crowd.  So, we thought there would be no way for us to find a seat inside. . . we were wrong.  It's pretty spacious with multiple pie-rooms (I think it's funny there are "pie rooms").   Long story short, we ordered a couple Young's London Stouts, and some steak and mushroom pies with a side of mash, and some cauliflower.  It was all really good, and seemed like they take pride in their cooking.  It was seriously good. The pub itself was also well laid-out, and seemed like a great place to hang out and have a few drinks.  I imagine if the crowd outside came inside it would be pretty crowded.  If I lived, or worked nearby, I'd probably go pretty often.

bhaeKCCz92RKdKxQRXBEyQ.text: My friend and I visited this place in the end of February after some shopping in London. When we came in around 5:30pm on a Thursday night, we went to the top floor and was asked if we had a reservation and answered no. There was no one else there and we were sat down. I don't know if it was just me but the waitress was not so friendly and she stared at my friend and I intensely the whole night while standing at the bar right across from our table, which made for an uncomfortable experience.I had the fish pie and rosé wine and shared a meringue dessert with my friend. They were relatively tasty, but I wish I had tried their award winning steak pie instead. It also took a while for our food to come out, but maybe that's normal when you order pies.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom

0vhqzNweubddqEBLtAWyXQ.text: There is a pie of the month video on their site. This is my favorite pie place in London that I have to visit every time I get to. Decent selection of real ales too. Pies and pints, who could ask for anything more!

TI5grRgYLvJQi6QfrtJjKg.text: What a great little place to end our evening!  We came here for their meat pies!  Hubby enjoyed tasting the beer and his beef and kidney pie. I had the chicken bacon pie with chips and a lemonade pimp.  We shared a bowl of pea mash. For desert we had the custard with apple crumble , I normally don't like custard but let me say I dipped my Apple crumble into the ramekin and clean it dry!We ate upstair in the open patio had to great servers that checked in to make we had everything we need, and they both were friendly and chatted with us.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Lemonade pimp
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Chicken bacon meat pie with chips
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Apple crumble with custard.

Kq5KowiXX7b3K4yF7RjCKQ.text: Steak and kidney pie was delicious. I read a lot of reviews and it lived up to all of them. The pie room offers a relaxed environment and has 7 beers on tap at the time of this review. Would definitely recommend.

C9AiBtgPhnIXhPPidvP4zA.text: Wouldn't let my group in on a a Monday night at 7:00. Restaurant was clearly not full.  I suspect because of our two young children.

vpr36zFUDR2EYIDf_yvDrg.text: Really good food and it's so lovely inside! Very generous pours of wine! The staff was very friendly and the pies were top notch!

MiyHlMqx7Vq6Ik-OipGbrw.text: Found this place on Yelp while shopping when we were starving. This place was so cute and the food was great! We ordered a shepard's pie and steak and mushroom pie and they were both delicious. I liked the shepard's pie a little bit more though. They have a good selection of seasonal beer but if you don't know the beers, you'll be blindly picking - although if you ask, they will let you try a little before you choose. Overall, this was a great first meal in London and if I ever go back, will return!

liVCvMQt6qqfLiIkavwXUg.text: Nice little pub round the corner from Sketch, serves Gin & Tonic and sells pies. Next time I'll try a pie!

okvaIICuNw6KjIuzshkv5g.text: excellent meat pies, burger and fries. Great local beers and a nice, casual atmosphere where local business people go for lunch. Friendly service and all around great place to eat.

pIXtnDY2NlwnBG3epjD6sQ.text: Great ambiance, music just loud enough to make conversations private but no so loud that they're difficult. Nice beer selection and the steak and kidney pie is delicious, the crust was perfect. Service is prompt and the atmosphere is casual and relaxed. Plenty of space, although it was a Monday night. I would recommend if you're in the area, but look local before making a special trip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Steak and kidney pie with chips, low light version.

quhvz-tIRLRwARASWBgr4Q.text: I had a hard time deciding what kind of food was London-specific that I NEEDED to try before leaving since I only had 2 days in the city. Then it dawned on me.. Shepherd's pie! I proceeded to check where I could find some and then I found this restaurant claiming to have the best. We came in around noon and the place was dead, which was not reassuring since it's prime-time lunch. We stayed anyway and our server was super friendlyShepherd's Pie - Learned that this is served with mashed potatoes and not a crust. The filling was good but I got tired of eating it after a while.Steak & Kidney Pie - Crust stole the show. It was awesome. I definitely enjoyed this more than the Shepherd's Pie. I did not get tired of it and finished this down to the very last crumb.They won an award for their steak & kidney pie so not that surprised that it was much better than the regular shepherd's pie. Cozy spot and good food. Next time I am craving pie in london, this is probably where I will go.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Shepard's pie

joPVgGXCJw6JZFe7wCZukA.text: Told they had the best pie in the City.  I can't validate that, but I can say it was amazing!

z-JxxxnremPEwXecet9qFw.text: Absolutely fantastic pub dinner! After getting turned away from the place we had originally planned on, the folks walking out behind us recommended The Windmill as a better option, and we were glad we listened! The crowd outside in the street with pints had us worried about the wait for a table as we walked upon, but apparently they were just having a pre-dinner drink, because we were lucky enough to get a table right away (another few minutes and we've have been out of luck though). Definitely a place for local professionals; which meant a bit loud as pints disappeared, but polite. The food was probably the best British food I've ever had actually. The bread, olives, and butter was a nice simple start, and more substantial than we'd expected, but the pies were truly outstanding. The Shepherd's Pie was delicious; a good balance of potato and filling, and the filling itself was rich and flavorful without being too rich or greasy like they can be. I was also impressed with the side of greens, which were somehow cooked to be slightly crispy, but weren't greasy or dried out. Definitely a winning meal, and a place that will be on the top of my list next time I'm in London.

xeCxDUxMt_sArBe3t9i5Dg.text: Came by the Windmill for dinner and it was delicious!! I had the ribs but we also ordered the fish and chips and steak and mushroom pie. Everything was SO good. The ribs came with slaw and potatoes, the meat just fell off the bone. Everything was flavorful!! The waitress was so accommodating and the service was good. This is a great place for lunch or dinner or even for drinks after work. There is a lot of seating inside (more than expected) if you're eating!! With more room by the bar and outside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom

LFFf11bm5n1AWkOJep9rdQ.text: Comfortable pub, great pies. Perfect place to escape the rain for an hour and think about nothing. I recommend the lamb pie. The suet crust was flaky and delicious, and the star of the dish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom

iwZN3uTXBxOa6yRZdFwbDQ.text: There's others, so make sure you've got the right Windmill!  This is absolutely the right Windmill. It turned out to be the perfect way to hide away from the snow. My wife and I shared the steak and mushroom pie, and I almost left her so I could spend the rest of my days with the chef, happily being hand-fed pies until gravy flows through my veins and I die of over-consumption. This was a delicious pie, is what I'm telling you. The perfect suet crust filled with a thick beef gravy, big steak chunks, and perfectly cooked (read: not rubber) mushrooms. I never eat mushrooms, but the flavor in this pie was so rich that I would eat anything with this gravy on it. They lost a star because the menu was so limited on our visit. After perusing the menu for a good 5 minutes, we were told the kitchen was down to about 4 items. Also, we ordered chips with our pie, but got mash instead. Did I care? Not once I ladled that gravy over the mash and ate like a fat king. In fact, everything was so delicious that we came back and each got our own pie.  No sharesies!The beer was a pretty standard selection based on our visit to other pubs.  I've seen more extensive selections, but they had a good grasp on what the people want, and our server was able to recommend good pairings with the pies.Be aware that this spot gets very busy once work lets out.  We stopped in around 2, but our second visit was closer to 5 and we had to elbow some people out of the way to get through.Come for the pie, stay for the beer, and leave so you can put on a disguise and come right back to eat another pie without shame.

s4-31Iu5fSrOgvLYnuNStQ.text: Loved their outdoor patio upstairs and the various pot pies were pretty tasty. They also provided a taster of their beer choices in cute little beer shaped shot glasses!

XpuqoL6sBHtnPdiYdMbpDw.text: Steak and Mushroom pie.This little beauty was quite simply the most delicious pie I've eaten. The pastry was flaky on the outside and warm and soft on the inside with a rich thick gravy and satisfying chunks of beef. Beware the whole bay leaf, be glad it's so wonderfully flavored!The teeny pot of gravy was on its own delicious, when added to the pie helped take it to another level.A lot of food on one plate, the chips were delicious, but I decided to leave them in favor of eating all the pie :)We walked in on a rainy early evening and couldn't have been greeted by a more welcoming true English pub atmosphere.Heartily recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Wonderful little steak and mushroom pie
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. The Pie shop 3

CZZR1uA7b7eq-_4NCSQYRw.text: Best shepherds pie...good amount of savory lamb and some minced vegetables topped with mashed potatoes and a small side of greens. Wish they had slightly more mashed potatoes, but the container was filled to the top and I wouldn't want them to reduce the meat portion for it.It's also a cool bar with lots of locals just drinking and smoking. I was there at 6pm on a Tuesday evening and it was packed. The upstairs was full and I had to share a table with some random people. They were friendly so it was an overall great experience.

cuxfbF4Mt8HGIrAgFXqBag.text: The fish pie was super tasty. ...none of the beers tasted like anything from the US. They were ok. This may not be a surprise, and trust me, I'm a connoisseur of the craft beer market stateside. It's packed. I recommend calling ahead if you want to sit down for dinner. Otherwise, show up and run the risk that you'll be drinking average beer and waiting for a table.

7tHUSi5EaIVJnLX3aBvt3A.text: My brother and I were trying to find some food to eat and stumbled upon this place when looking for pies.  What a great place!  We came in around 6 PM and was about to give up on the place since there weren't any seats available when we saw an opening.  I'm glad we decided to take it, since the pies were really quite up to the hype.  I got a game pie and my brother got a steak and mushroom.  Both were very delicious.  The crusts were crispy and the filling was perfectly seasoned.  The side of mash was excellent as well and is the perfect (and classic) accompaniment to the pie. In addition to this, we got some beers, which just made this quite an awesome meal.  The atmosphere of the place was very pub like.  As a pub, that makes sense, but it didn't really hit me until I got there.  There were a bunch of people chatting away and drinking beers and stuff.  Even the private rooms were booked and full of people.  There were just so many people all around, which was why I was surprised a seat even opened up when it did.  Let that be a note of warning if you plan to come here around dinner time.  For the food though, definitely recommend to anyone visiting.  I found the pie to be absolutely amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Game pie, cut open. Yum!
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Game pie
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Just a couple of ales to try out

AUStjzTvSWvksArM-6W2_Q.text: Great atmosphere up on top with the rooftop terrace. The pies were exceptional and service was great but would love to write home about the atmosphere!!

1qqZgdV-Occ5q05EmkptKw.text: Nice place! Friendly, good service, prices as expected and reasonable. Had a couple pints of Bitter and a pork pie snack. Both excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom. Yongs bitter and a small pork pie. Very good!

-vbyEZJigthfr47vcNE4UA.text: 4.5 stars, maybe 5. Best pies I ever had.The kidney pie might have not enough kidney and too much mushrooms but the seasonal venison pie was extraordinary. Perfectly seasoned and tasty, just the exact same way I'd cook it.The pie crust was so fresh and crispy, cooked to perfection.The side of spinash was perfect: under-cooked, minced spinash with butter..Lovely staff, nice brown ales. Perfect British traditional place. a MUST TRY if you want to have the best meat pie while you're staying in London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windmill - London, United Kingdom

bZDXcDr20OwBwlzF0fRa_A.text: The pies were ok.  The filling was great.  The pie crust just wasn't good.  Maybe I don't know my pies, but I like the crust to be flaky and to fall apart.  The crust here was stiff and dense.Love the space and very good service.  Delicious mash and gravy.

a0XQzvbhlkEp39zULt5wyQ.text: Best Shepherd's pie I have ever had. Crust was very flaky, this place is a must go if you are in the area. Perfect meal after a cold day of sightseeing. Great atmosphere, I will be back for another pie. Steak and mushroom pie is also delicious.

FWiUhZIE6z54RNk6AsVbhg.text: Amazing meat pies. I tried the the pie of the day (game). I'm not sure what I was expecting but it surpassed that. It was so juicy and full of large chunks of meat.For those who aren't from around there (like myself), you order at the bar, pay and pick a table. They will bring you the food when its ready.This is a great area to explore with lots of locals hanging outside enjoying their drinks

NdSM2gZGgRZa0cki_mO-JA.text: The Windmill Pub prides itself on its meat pies and for very good reason.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting and the staff are friendly, if a bit overtaxed.  But the meat pies are the stars of the show and they shine brightly.  You might find a better meat pie elsewhere, but I doubt it.

oEW6btAwN0ZLZFw__qBP2Q.text: Good place to visit if you like Ales and Pies. The shepherd's pie is the best I have tried  in London. We went after Christmas and they were running short of food options. It was a pity because we were looking to have some beers and eat some shepherd pies again. Maybe next time we will be with more luck. Cheers mate!

49pJ2KgIw9iwhVBBpBDDjQ.text: Fish n chips were pretty good. Plenty of food. Kidney pie was great also. Beer selection was good. Service was ok. Ambiance and decor was as a London pub should be.

b49mWX9Xc-sqtpt88tBjsQ.text: Delicious food and lively atmosphere. The evening was slightly dimmed by being seated next to an extremely loud private party which made normal conversation difficult.Definitely recommend the food and will return.
